comments:
i20050331

(This might be related to bug 89868)

When debugging with plug-ins coming from the target (that I also have in the
workspace as source), there are two problems:
- source for classes in plug-ins coming from the target is not automatically found
- breakpoint condition "silently" fails to evaluate (always stopping) producing
the following log entries.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 120 2005-03-31 15:51:04.307
!MESSAGE Internal error logged from JDI Debug: 
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Unable to compile conditional breakpoint
- missing Java project context.
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.breakpoints.JavaLineBreakpoint.handleConditionalBreakpointEvent(JavaLineBreakpoint.java:474)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.breakpoints.JavaLineBreakpoint.handleBreakpointEvent(JavaLineBreakpoint.java:393)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.breakpoints.JavaBreakpoint.handleEvent(JavaBreakpoint.java:256)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.dispatch(EventDispatcher.java:172)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.run(EventDispatcher.java:221)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 5012 2005-03-31 15:51:04.323
!MESSAGE Unable to compile conditional breakpoint - missing Java project context.

If a plugin is external and not referenced by any workspace plugin that you 
are launching with, it will not be on the source lookup path.  Debugger would 
ask you to manually attach source.  That is expected behavior as said external 
JAR is not within the Java search scope.

Not sure what the exception below means.

What plug-ins are in your workspace as source? and where is the breakpoint 
located?

Plug-in: 
org.eclipse.osgi

Breakpoint:
PluginConverterImpl [line: 664] [conditional] - convertManifest(File, boolean,
String, boolean, Dictionary)

Condition:
pluginBaseLocation.getCanonicalPath().indexOf("workbench") >= 0

This worked for me (using latest)

* Started new empty workspace
* imported org.eclipse.osgi from CVS HEAD
* added breakpoint as specified with condition
* launched runtime workbench (with -clean)
> hit breakpoint several times with nothing in the log.

If I import org.eclipse.osgi as a binary project with linked content, then 
this error occurrs.

And with the fix to bug 89489 this scenario also works. Rafael, can you 
confirm your workspace configuration - i.e. what format is org.eclipse.osgi 
in? source or imported as a binary project?

Re: comment 4 

It is not clear you tweaked your launch configuration to use org.eclipse.osgi
from the target and not the one from the workspace. That is required to make the
problem happen.

Re: comment 6

It is checked out from HEAD. But when running, I set it to come from the target.

OK, when I change the launch setting to get the org.eclipse.osgi from the 
target, I get the same problem. Thanks for the clarification.

The problem is as Wassim describes in comment#1. In this case, the only thing 
on the source lookup path is the JRE itself. All other plug-in class files are 
found in the target (for the runtime), but source lookup is not configured 
properly to find the source.

As well, since there is no java project assocaited with the source, we are 
unable to compile\evaluate conditional expressions.

Need to discuss with Wassim, as I think there are two issues here:
(1) PDE may be able to provide a better source lookup path
(2) Expression evaluation still requires a "java project" context in which to 
compile the expressions

traces.message: Unable to compile conditional breakpoint - missing Java project context.
